Class Encryption

  • public class Encryption
extends java.lang.Object

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void caesarAlgo(boolean split)
      The Caesar Algorithm used to encrypt file it print it's name and then start record time for encryption initialize the files required to read and to write to getting the keys for that algorithm (if split equals true - add the next key that in keys) check that the keys are correct and cannot cause data loss and then read the file byte by byte and encrypting it after that set the end time to measure time it took to encrypt
      void chooseMethod(java.util.LinkedList<java.lang.Integer> set, boolean split)
      The chooseMethod function used to handle set of actions it pops the next action that need to done at the given set and handle it in switch case in case of choose=5 it creates decryption object and sending it the current file that need to be encrypted and if wer'e encrypting it in folder and sending booleans that indicate 1.false -that wer'e not decrypting (wer'e currently calling it from encryption) 2.false -that wer'e not in sync (not relevant because wer'e handling one file here) 3.true - that we have the set for the required operation (the set that wer'e using here)
      void createKeyFile()
      function required for creating a key.bin file in folder encryption or at current location and print to it the keys required later on to decryption
      void doubleAlgo(java.util.LinkedList<java.lang.Integer> set, boolean split)
      The Double Algorithm used to encrypt one file it print it's name and then start record time for encryption calling the chooseMethod function twice and if split equals true increment the numOfEnc for that (that we will read the next keys) after that set the end time to measure time it took to encrypt
      int getInput()
      simple method to get one int user input
      void multiplicationAlgo(boolean split)
      The Multiplication Algorithm used to encrypt file it print it's name and then start record time for encryption initialize the files required to read and to write to getting the keys for that algorithm (if split equals true - add the next key that in keys) check that the keys are correct and cannot cause data loss and then read the file byte by byte and encrypting it after that set the end time to measure time it took to encrypt
      void reverseAlgo(java.util.LinkedList<java.lang.Integer> set, boolean split)
      The Reverse Algorithm used to encrypt one file it print it's name it pops the next action that need to done at the given set and handle it in switch case it setting the keys of the decryption object to the keys that been generated here so it uses them and calls the method in decryption
      void xorAlgo(boolean split)
      The Xor Algorithm used to encrypt file it print it's name and then start record time for encryption initialize the files required to read and to write to getting the keys for that algorithm (if split equals true - add the next key that in keys) check that the keys are correct and cannot cause data loss and then read the file byte by byte and encrypting it after that set the end time to measure time it took to encrypt

    • Constructor Detail

      • Encryption

        public Encryption(java.lang.String name,
                  boolean encFolder,
                  boolean isEncrypting,
                  boolean sync,
                  boolean hasSet)
        This constructor initialize the arguments required for encryption, and checks what should be executed:
        Parameters:
        name - the name of file/folder to be encrypted
        encFolder - encrypt file or a folder,
        sync - encrypt them in sync method or async
        isEncrypting - check if it needs to be encrypted or decrypted
        hasSet - check if someone wants to supply the Set of actions or it needs to be created

    • Method Detail

      • getInput

        public int getInput()
        simple method to get one int user input
        Returns:
        the user input int

      • multiplicationAlgo

        public void multiplicationAlgo(boolean split)
                        throws KeyException,
                               java.io.IOException
        The Multiplication Algorithm used to encrypt file it print it's name and then start record time for encryption initialize the files required to read and to write to getting the keys for that algorithm (if split equals true - add the next key that in keys) check that the keys are correct and cannot cause data loss and then read the file byte by byte and encrypting it after that set the end time to measure time it took to encrypt
        Parameters:
        split - representing if we're at split algorithm
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - in case of error on reading/writing file
        KeyException - in case of invalid key that can cause data loss etc..

      • xorAlgo

        public void xorAlgo(boolean split)
             throws java.io.IOException,
                    KeyException
        The Xor Algorithm used to encrypt file it print it's name and then start record time for encryption initialize the files required to read and to write to getting the keys for that algorithm (if split equals true - add the next key that in keys) check that the keys are correct and cannot cause data loss and then read the file byte by byte and encrypting it after that set the end time to measure time it took to encrypt
        Parameters:
        split - representing if we're at split algorithm
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - in case of error on reading/writing file
        KeyException - in case of invalid key that can cause data loss etc..

      • caesarAlgo

        public void caesarAlgo(boolean split)
                throws java.io.IOException,
                       KeyException
        The Caesar Algorithm used to encrypt file it print it's name and then start record time for encryption initialize the files required to read and to write to getting the keys for that algorithm (if split equals true - add the next key that in keys) check that the keys are correct and cannot cause data loss and then read the file byte by byte and encrypting it after that set the end time to measure time it took to encrypt
        Parameters:

        Throws:

      • doubleAlgo

        public void doubleAlgo(java.util.LinkedList<java.lang.Integer> set,
                       boolean split)
                throws java.io.IOException,
                       KeyException
        The Double Algorithm used to encrypt one file it print it's name and then start record time for encryption calling the chooseMethod function twice and if split equals true increment the numOfEnc for that (that we will read the next keys) after that set the end time to measure time it took to encrypt
        Parameters:
        set - representing the set of actions that remained undone
        split - representing if we're at split algorithm
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - in case of error on reading/writing file
        KeyException - in case of invalid key that can cause data loss etc..

      • reverseAlgo

        public void reverseAlgo(java.util.LinkedList<java.lang.Integer> set,
                        boolean split)
                 throws java.io.IOException,
                        KeyException
        The Reverse Algorithm used to encrypt one file it print it's name it pops the next action that need to done at the given set and handle it in switch case it setting the keys of the decryption object to the keys that been generated here so it uses them and calls the method in decryption
        Parameters:
        set - representing the set of actions that remained undone
        split - representing if we're at split algorithm
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - in case of error on reading/writing file
        KeyException - in case of invalid key that can cause data loss etc..

      • chooseMethod

        public void chooseMethod(java.util.LinkedList<java.lang.Integer> set,
                         boolean split)
                  throws java.io.IOException,
                         KeyException
        The chooseMethod function used to handle set of actions it pops the next action that need to done at the given set and handle it in switch case in case of choose=5 it creates decryption object and sending it the current file that need to be encrypted and if wer'e encrypting it in folder and sending booleans that indicate 1.false -that wer'e not decrypting (wer'e currently calling it from encryption) 2.false -that wer'e not in sync (not relevant because wer'e handling one file here) 3.true - that we have the set for the required operation (the set that wer'e using here)
        Parameters:
        set - representing the set of actions that remained undone
        split - representing if we're at split algorithm
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - in case of error on reading/writing file
        KeyException - in case of invalid key that can cause data loss etc..

                   throws java.io.IOException
        function required for creating a key.bin file in folder encryption or at current location and print to it the keys required later on to decryption
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - in case of error on reading/writing file
